contentrichtext.text: '''John Erik Franzén''' (born 1942) is a [[Sweden|Swedish]] [[artist]], mainly a [[Painting|painter]], born in [[Stockholm]], most known for several large paintings portraying [[Automobile|car]]s and [[motorcycle]]s, as well as being the artist behind the portrait of the royal family of Sweden added to the public exhibition at the castle in [[Gripsholm]] in 1985, and original paintings for several [[Postage stamp|stamp]]s also portraying members of the royal family. In the 1960s he visited the [[United States]] for a long period and painted such works as ''[[Hells Angels|Hell's Angels]] of [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]], CA'', ''Dough's Place'' and ''Cadillac Eldorado'' (1966). Between 1988 and 1995 he served as a [[professor]] or art at the High School of Arts in Stockholm and he is a member of the Swedish Royal Academy of the Free Arts since 1989. Since 1991 he lives in [[Österlen]], [[Skåne|Scania]]. ==External links== *[http://www.enjoyscandinavianart.com/frj/infofrj.htm Swedish link] {{Authority control|VIAF=4224711}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Franzen, John Erik | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swedish artist | DATE OF BIRTH = 1942 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Franzen, John Erik}} [[Category:1942 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Swedish painters]] {{Sweden-artist-stub}}
